column4: could anyone help me out with this: when i go to places and network connections, it prompts me for a password to log onto my network, the password i set isnt right, but i can hit cancel and still access my files, but to play the mp3 files i have to copy them from remote computer then paste them to local disk. smb://familypcu/mymusic is where the file is located according to file info
places then network servers rather..
hmm, you'd probably be better off just mounting the samba share.  i.e. mount -t smbfs -o username=windowsuser //familycpu/mymusic /mnt/mymusicfolder
it says could not resolve mount point
sorry forgot to mention your name up there
did you make a directory for it?  mkdir /mnt/mymusicshare
no
i will though
so should i do for example... mount -t smbfs -o username=kditty //familycpu/mymusic /mnt/mymusic after i do; mkdir /mnt/mymusic
yep
i get 7396: Connection to familycpu failed
does user "kditty" exist on familycpu?  can you ping familycpu by name?
im so confused with the user names etc, i know i have a username on win xp as kditty, i know that familypcu is the name of the network server
on this computer, for some reason it changed to root@familycomputer:/home/kditty# a few days ago
familycomputer is the name and familypcu is the workgroup i believe
hey vook, i can access my files on that network, i just have to copy them from the winxp and paste them to ubuntu
so that lets me know that i have some sort of connection, right?
ok, what are you trying to do?
just play my files from my other computer, without having to copy and paste them. is that possible?
yeah, type "df" at the command line, it may already be mounted
if i want to listen to an album, i have to copy it from familypcu and then paste it to this one
its not mounted, i get a connection error when i try to mount the folder
